name: Increment defense counter
_source: s;Euclid;They're actually retreating...{w} We've held them off.{w}{br}The Pelopos Senate survives another day.
s;Euclid;Simon, I need to thank you for your help today.{w}{br}Without you all, Pelopos would have collpased into chaos without its rulers' wisdom.
s;Simon;Of course. You needed our help, and we were here.{w}{br}Plus, Pelopos can be a valuable ally, despite its less-than-favorable views of the nobility.
s;Senator;You can't expect to buy an alliance with your swords.
s;OldMan1;You, scholar held true to your city, which has nutured your mind and given you shelter since your birth.{w}{br}It is only natural you repay it.
s;OldMan1;And you, lordling, defeated these ruffians, warranting a small payment.

s;OldMan1;But you cannot hope for anything beyond this for the work mere mercenaries could have accomplished.{w}{br}I would rather fall to ruin than see Pelopos be swallowed up by some foolish lord's ambitious.
s;Euclid;Senator, you misunderstand. Simon is wise, and he wouldn't seek to undermine Pelopos's freedom.

s;OldMan1;How could he possess true wisdom if his mind was not nurtured by the great minds of our land?{w}{br}He possesses a soul of silver:{w} fit for combat and capable of minor heroics,{w} but not holding wisdom sufficient to rule.{w}{br}Now, please excuse me. We must plan to develop defenses against future threats of this kind.
s;Simon;We just saved your life, you ungrateful-
s;Euclid;Pelopos is a great city.{w} We have better minds than anywhere, and the best among us rule.{w}{br}But you and your companions have shown me that even foreigners can possess wisdom.
s;Euclid;Your mind still needs further refinement, of course,{w} and you must reconsider your monarchical ambitions,{w} but you will make a just ruler.
s;Simon;I guess I'll take that as a compliment?
